meanings.sent1: The children decided to circumambulate the playground before starting their game.
meanings.sent2: I like to circumambulate the park in the mornings for exercise.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to circumambulate the tree but got distracted by a bird.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to circumambulate around the idea of traveling the world.
meanings.sent5: The river appeared to circumambulate the mountain, creating a serene landscape.

meanings.definition: To move in a circular path around (something)
meanings.sent1: The dancers will circumambulate the stage during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The cars had to circumambulate the fallen tree blocking the road.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to circumambulate the room and avoid obstacles.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to circumambulate as we waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The planets circumambulate the sun in their orbits, following the laws of gravity.
